title: The beginning
description: Inspired by USCRPL and Skyward Experimental Rocketry, a group of friends started designing an experimental sounding rocket.

title: Building Project Cavour: from conception to commission proposal
description:
The group laid the groundwork and crafted the initial design for what would evolve into Project Cavour.

The Founders presented the project to establish a dedicated student team for rocket engineering to Professor Alfonso Pagani, who staunchly supported the initiative.

title: Proposal submission
description: The proposal for the formation of a recognized student team was formally submitted to Politecnico di Torino’s budget and projects commission on April 14th, 2022.

title: Team approval and start of Project Cavour
description: On June 7th 2022, Politecnico di Torino officially approved the Team, which started working on Project Cavour.

title: Establishing of Project Efesto
description: Along with the work of the sounding rocket Cavour, in fall 2022 the Team established Project Efesto under the lead of the CE Matteo Crachi, to research and develop Italy’s first student-made bi-liquid rocket engine with a focus on sustainability.

title: Project Cavour makes history
description: In October 2022, Project Cavour, directed by CE Fabio Meloni, achieved the distinction of being the first Italian project selected for the 2023 Spaceport America Cup (SA CUP), the world’s largest rocketry intercollegiate competition.

title: Start of Project Efesto
description: After the first general recruitment, Project Efesto was started to research and develop a Liquid Rocket Engine for the Team's rockets.

title: Successful test launch of Cavour rocket
description: The Cavour rocket completed its design phase in early 2023 and underwent assembly and testing in April 2023, culminating in a successful test launch in Germany at 19:53:42 CET. This launch marked a historic moment for the student team at Politecnico di Torino, concluding with the perfect recovery and subsequent reuse of the rocket.

title: 2023 Spaceport America Cup and second Cavour launch
description: The a.y. concluded at the end of June 2023, with Project Cavour competing in the 2023 SA CUP, in the 10k feet apogee with COTS solid propulsion category. The rocket was successfully launched and recovered at Spaceport America, in New Mexico, USA.

title: 2023 European Rocketry Challenge
description: The team became the first to compete with Project Cavour at the 2023 EuRoC, Europe's major rocket engineering competition.

title: 2024 European Rocketry Challenge
description: After the conclusion of Project Cavour, a new project was started under CE Edoardo Viglietti for a competition rocket, named Vittorio Emanuele II (VES), with the goal of launching a solid propelled rocket with 9km target apogee.
